intro: Pseudognaphalium pellitum, commonly known as the slender leaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its foliage is covered in fine, silky hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments.
